DOCUMENT 153
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
2/14/2025 3:59 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
MOTION FOR REUNIFICATION COUNSELOR
Comes now the Plaintiff/Respondent, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney, Dianne James Davis, and files this Motion for Reunification Counselor for reunification
therapy and would state as follows:
1. That Counselor, Kelly Turner has provided an Affidavit to the Court as she could not appear
on February 13, 2025;
2. That in the Affidavit, Kelly Turner has reached conclusions regarding the Father with having
only email interaction;
3. That Kelly Turner made very prejudicial statements regarding the Father in her Affidavit
without having any conversation or in person meeting;
4. That Counsel for the Father plans to call Kelly Turner as a witness at the next hearing as she
was unable to cross examine her “Affidavit”.
5. That in Kelly Turner’s Affidavit, she states that “As a professional, with 25 years of
experience and over 100 cases working with custody/divorce/alienation, this situation
felt highly manipulative and as a professional, I realized that this process was not going
to be conducive, nor effective, and a decision was made to withdrawal”.
6. That the Father feels a fresh start with a new counselor would be in the best interest of the
minor child, A.K.M. and Mother.
7. That as of the last email correspondence with Kelly Turner, she withdrew – a copy attached
as EXHIBIT A.
8. That the Father had NEVER allowed his daughter to miss any of these appointments and has
re-arranged other doctor’s appointments to make the appointment with Mrs. Turner.
DOCUMENT 153
9. That the Father has reason to believe the Mother has moved in with her boyfriend in Clanton,
Alabama, without proper notice. That the Mother now works in Clanton and that due to the
limited meetings with the Mother, child, and Kelly Turner, the Father does not feel the
therapy has not gotten in depth to the point it would detrimental. That it would be more
convenient for the mother and child for a Reunification Expert in the Birmingham area which
would be to the Mother’s home and work.
10. In light of the Affidavit of Kelly Turner filed with this Court on February 12, 2025, the Father
feels that a therapist that can be effective in the reunification process.
11. That on Kelly Turner’s website, nowhere does it list reunification therapy, although the
Mother’s attorney stated many times that Kelly Turner is an “EXPERT” in reunification
therapy. See Exhibit “B”
12. That Counsel for Father would recommend Caroline Taylor, located in Homewood, Alabama.
That Mrs. Taylor is an expert in reunification therapy and a highly respected Counselor. That
Mrs. Taylor’s website lists her many services, one of which is Reunification Services:
When a parent loses contact with a child for any reason the court may order
reunification therapy. In this form of family therapy, I work with the children and
parents on healing relationships in the family system. Information attached at Exhibit
“C”.
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, and due to the fathe the former counselor has
withdrawn, the Plaintiff/Father request this Honorable Court appoint Caroline Taylor, a specialist
in reunification for the mother and child.
Respectfully submitted this the 14th day of February, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (Facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
DOCUMENT 153
Certificate of Service
I hereby certify that I have served a copy of the foregoing upon the following via
electronic filing in the AlaCourt E-File System and/or by placing a copy of same, properly
addressed and postage paid in the U.S. Mail on this the 14th day of February, 2025.
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
/s/Dianne James Davis
Of Counsel

learn to feel your feelings, and practicing gratitude is the first step to positive Change!
